RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACHEN'S RIDGE stalked the earlier pace from the three path, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead past the pole, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on well. WINDSOR'S TRACKER rated close off the rail on the opening turn, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, entered the stretch at even terms but reluctantly ceded the final sixteenth. BERNIE THE GAMBLER settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn at the rail, then dueled through the stretch for third. FELICIAS CASTLE settled in the four path on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, came in across the path of Maddeye Moody nearing the eighth pole and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. S S SPARTAN ENERGY settled off the rail, eased out and picked up the chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the five path and ran evenly in the lane. MIO GRACELAND took over nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure and was met leaving the seven sixteenths pole, gave chase from that point but faded at the rail on the far turn. MADDEYE MOODY rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn three wide, was shut off nearing the eighth pole and weakened in the lane. ROCKET J. rated close inside on the first turn then faded through the backstretch. YDOUHAVETOBESOMEAN saved early ground. The Stewards reviewed and dismissed a claim of foul for alleged interference in the stretch, lodged by the rider of Windsor's Tracker, against the rider of Machen's Ridge. The Stewards also reviewed a claim of foul for interference nearing the eighth pole, lodged by the rider of Maddeye Moody, against the rider of Felicias Castle, and as a result, disqualified the the latter to seventh place for interfering with the former in the vicinity of the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Tracker
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Mio Graceland
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/4,rated pace,met past 7/16,chased,faded rail turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Wh ere Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LEG UP rated close to the early pace in the two and three paths, gave chase into the backstretch, contested even terms two deep on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over SPIRIT OF WINDSOR in later strides. The latter raced with the early pace three wide and took the lead into the backstretch, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, was met at even terms nearest the rail on the far turn and dug in gamely before reluctantly ceding late strides. SEATTLE SAILAWAY settled off the rail on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and came along for third later yards. MODERN DAY ROMANCE rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the two and three paths then flattened later yards. TYRY TYRANNOSAURUS saved ground well off the pace and showed little response through the backstretch. SIENTE EL AMOR raced with the early pace two deep, took a brief lead between horses on the first turn then gave chase from the half mile pole, but faded at the rail on the far turn. JEFFERSON SECURITY was hustled along to take a brief early lead, gave up the lead midway on the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Modern Day Romance
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 5/16,2& 3p far turn,flattened late yard

ENTRY.NAME: Seattle Sailaway
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out 1/2,bid 3/8,4p far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Siente El Amor
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,brief lead 1st turn,chased 1/2,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Leg Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARSANNE became edgy in the gate, dueled for the lead leaving the seven sixteenths pole but bore out and gave up the advantage midway on the turn, left the turn wide but dug in to recover the edge in the final strides. AVALANCHE IS COMIN chased the pace, rounded the turn in the three path and dug in from the head of the lane to take second in later yards, while outfinished for the win. CALERA LOVE had a brief early lead then gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, took over at the rail midway on the turn but was met and relented in later yards. PROUD PERFORMER chased, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. I'M HEADING EAST gave chase outside, rounded the turn in the six path and showed little in the lane. IRISH VALENTINE gave chase outside, rounded the turn in the seven path and showed little in the lane. DEAREST M. A. ducked in at the break then saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Calera Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead,chased,up rail mid turn,met later yards,relented

ENTRY.NAME: Marsanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy gate,up past 7/16,bore out turn,wide 1/8,recovered late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LADY QUINN pressured the pace and contested even terms two deep on the turn, dug in determinedly leaving the turn and drew clear the final yards. JUBA'S HOUSE gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and dug in through the lane to take second the final strides. LUNAR PRAYER set a pressured pace from the half mile pole, contested even terms at the rail on the turn and dug in through the lane, but relented the final yards. TWO STEP SALLY ducked out and hit the stall gate at the break, picked up the chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. STOPWATCHSONNY gave close early chase, rounded the turn in the four path, left the turn outside and ran evenly in the stretch. RIGHT TO ASSEMBLE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. SHAKE IT GIRL gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the five path.

ENTRY.NAME: Lunar Prayer
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside,even terms rail turn,relented late

ENTRY.NAME: Two Step Sally
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,hit gate,chased inside,rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Quinn
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Michael E. Lauer & Ralph T. Piercy

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 6 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12 ,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOGSTRADAMUS raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead into the backstretch and came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled to hold on well. CHASENJOHNATHAN stalked off the rail on the opening turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the turn, then dueled through the stretch for second. GRUMPY'S BUDDY saved ground off the pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. I'M THE MONEY MAN stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. NEVERFOLD rounded the opening turn about the five path, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and flattened in the lane. IN HIGH GEAR rounded the opening turn about the three path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole but showed little response. NEVERPOPTHECORK raced in the six path on the first turn, left the turn outside and never factored. SWISS LEGACY rated a slim lead inside, was met into the backstretch and gave chase from that point but faded leaving the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Chasenjohnathan
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rai,bid 7/16,off rail far turn,dueled 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REVEIRS MINUTE was bumped leaving the gate, showed the way through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, pulled herself to the front at the seven sixteenths pole and raced clear from the five sixteenths, was urged at the rail on the far turn then steadily handled in the lane. BAYS CASTLE raced well off the pace while between horses on the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the turn in the three path, eased out entering the stretch and dug in to take second under the wire. KATALIMA rated off the pace and off the rail early, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn but was nipped from second under the wire. ARROWWOOD rounded the opening turn about the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, then flattened the final sixteenth. TIZBIT rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then weakened in the lane. CURLIN'S DOVE came away rank and made contact with Reveirs Minute, took the lead at the rail into the first turn and rated the pace, was met toward the seven sixteenths pole, gave chase from that point but weakened at the rail on the far turn. HOVEL saved ground. TAPPING SOUTH raced three wide on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Tizbit
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Hovel
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormick Gloria F and O'Hara Vicki

ENTRY.NAME: Katalima
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,bid 3/8,2d far turn,nipped 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Bays Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,bid 3/8,3p far turn,eased out 1/8,up 2nd wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OFFICER STONE gave chase and took the lead two deep midway on the turn, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on well. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE broke awkwardly then gave chase, was carried outward on the turn, entered the stretch widest but finished well to take second the final strides. NEEDNOEXPLANATION drew clear past the half mile pole and tapered in while rating the pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, was met a the rail midway on the turn and relented mid-stretch. HARLEY SIOUX ducked out leaving the gate, gave chase inside but drifted outward on the turn and flattened later yards. MEETMARYSMAN chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LAST PARTY gave chase then faded at the rail on the turn. CRUSH 'N RUN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. LIEUTENANT BROWN broke a step slow then hit the stall gate at the break and just galloped around.

ENTRY.NAME: Harley Sioux
ENTRY.OWNER: Straughn William E and Thacker Daniel
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,chased inside,drifted turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Last Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Katina M

ENTRY.NAME: Neednoexplanation
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early pace,pressured 5/16,met rail mid turn,relented 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since M arch 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM BOARDER (CHI) took the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily encouraged through the stretch. FREE DANCER gave chase and raced two deep on the turn then finished well to take second in the final strides. PRIMAL DESTINY pressured the early pace then gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the turn and was nipped from second the final strides. GOLDEN G lunged at the break and was steadied on the chute, gave chase inside through the backstretch, eased outward midway on the turn, entered the stretch about the six path and finished well outside. FULLY CONNECTED pressured the early pace, dropped back at the five sixteenths pole and rounded the turn near the rail, then weakened in the lane. MR TINGLES engaged in close early chase but faded at the rail approaching the five sixteenths pole. CAIRO CALLING chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Free Dancer
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Boarder (CHI)
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steady urging lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: M'LADY THATCHER raced in the three path the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn three wide, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew clear later yards. VICTORIAN RIVIERA took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and rated the pace into the first turn, came under pressure toward the three eighths, rounded the far turn near the rail, was met mid-stretch and relented inside the sixteenth pole. SUPER SWEETIE broke a step slow and rounded the first turn off the rail, left the turn outside and bid past the seven sixteenths pole, raced five wide on the far turn, bore out toward the head of the lane but came on through the stretch and just missed second. CHANTILLY MOON (PER) saved ground off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. LINDA'S TAJ tapered in and raced with the early pace then stalked into the first turn, challenged toward the three eighths pole but dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. SWEET FACTOR rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. BABKA settled off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. RACE N RETURN veered out at the break, rounded the first turn about the five path then saved ground on the far turn. COAST TO GLORY ducked out leaving the gate then rated close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Coast to Glory
ENTRY.OWNER: Lucas Bonnie Noll Alfred and Irace Joseph
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,rated close off rail,chased 7/16,weakened turn

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Robert K. Randal, Meghan Randal & Jared A. Hughes

ENTRY.NAME: Race N Return
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,5p 1st turn,saved ground far turn
